Live from NPR News in Washington I'm jak sphere six days after hurricane Michael hit parts of the Florida Panhandle are still without electricity or drinkable water NPR's Quil Lawrence reports many are still missing after the storm
Hundreds of people are still living in shelters thousands or starting the painstaking process of trying to file insurance claims or hire contractors or get assistance from FEMA
While the search for survivors is over poor phone and Internet service has made it difficult for people to let their loved ones no they're okay in the devastated town of Mexico beach it's still not clear how many of about two hundred people who stayed through the storm might not have survived
Eleven thousand military personnel and their families evacuated from ten to air force base which took a direct hit they're still waiting for permission to get back to their homes on the base Quil Lawrence NPR News Miramar Beach Florida
President Donald Trump is denying he ever offered a million dollars to a charity over choice for Senator Elizabeth Warren to take a DNA test whether she had Native American ancestors though
He said exactly that this past summer at a rally in Montana worn widely expected to run as a twenty twenty presidential candidates today released results of a DNA test bunting quote strong evidence she is Native Americans in her family tree
Drop as long taunted Warren calling her Pocahontas during the campaign wanted a message on Twitter day requested the money go to a Native American women's group [noise]
The archdiocese of Washington DC has released a list of twenty eight priests credibly accused of sexual abuse over the past Seventy years NPR's Tom Gjelten says the move comes just four days after Pope Francis accepted the resignation of the Washington archbishop cardinal Donald Wuerl in
Accompanying the release of the list the archdiocese set of came from a review of its archives ordered by car no world in twenty Seventeen list was drawn up according to the archdiocese is a necessary step towards full transparency and accountability every priests
List was drawn up according to the archdiocese than necessary step towards full transparency and accountability
Every priest on the list was either removed from the ministry arrested or die before his case was fully pursued
The archdiocese has not opened his files to law enforcement as victim advocates have called for the survivors network noticed snap dismissed the move is quote a hastily assembled PR stunt Tom Gjelten NPR News Washington
Paul Allen who cofounded Microsoft with his childhood friend Bill Gates has died down and reported to have died from complications from non Hodgkin's lymphoma in Seattle just weeks after announcing he'd restarted treatment a decade after first battling the disease
Avid sports fan Arlen owned the Portland TrailBlazers and the Seattle Seahawks he also gave more than two billion door wide range of philanthropic interests
Bill Gates in a statement said today I'm heartbroken by the passing of one of my oldest and dearest friends Paul Allen was sixty five years old
Stocks close lower today the Dow down eighty nine points to the NASDAQ vote sixty six points yes and he was down sixteen points today this is NPR
